DCL OS Services: Date and Time

Send comments on this topic.

Summary

DclOsFileTimeToDclTime   Convert the OS FILETIME to DCL time.
DclOsGetDateTime   Get the current GMT date and time encoded as the number of microseconds since 1-1-1970.
DclOsHighResTickCount   Return the current high resolution tick count.
DclOsHighResTickModulus   Return the high resolution tick modulus.
DclOsHighResTickResolution   This function calculates the high-res tick resolution in picoseconds per tick (one trillionth of a second).
DclOsTickCount   Get the current system tick count.
DclOsTickModulus   Get the system tick modulus.
DclOsTickResolution   Get the system tick resolution in microseconds per tick.

DclOsFileTimeToDclTime

void DclOsFileTimeToDclTime(
    D_TIME *pTime,
    FILETIME *pFileTime)
Convert the OS FILETIME to DCL time.

Parameters

pTime - A buffer to receive the date/time
pFileTime - A pointer to the FILETIME structure to use.

Return Value

None.

DclOsGetDateTime

D_BOOL DclOsGetDateTime( D_TIME *pTime)
Get the current GMT date and time encoded as the number of microseconds since 1-1-1970.

Parameters

pTime - A pointer to a D_TIME variable to receive the result.

Return Value

Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

DclOsHighResTickCount

D_UINT64 DclOsHighResTickCount(void)
Return the current high resolution tick count. The tick resolution can be determined by calling DclOsHighResTickResolution. It must be assumed that the tick count will roll over at some point.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns the current high resolution tick value.

DclOsHighResTickModulus

D_UINT64 DclOsHighResTickModulus(void)
Return the high resolution tick modulus. This is the number of legitimate tick values. If the tick rolls over, then the tick modulus must be zero.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns the high resolution tick modulus.

DclOsHighResTickResolution

D_UINT64 DclOsHighResTickResolution(void)
This function calculates the high-res tick resolution in picoseconds per tick (one trillionth of a second).

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns the high res tick resolution in picoseconds per tick.

DclOsTickCount

D_UINT32 DclOsTickCount(void)
Get the current system tick count. The tick resolution can be determined by calling DclOsTickResolution. It must be assumed that the tick count will roll over at some point.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns the current system tick value.

DclOsTickModulus

D_UINT32 DclOsTickModulus(void)
Get the system tick modulus. This is the number of legitimate tick values. If the tick rolls over, then the tick modulus must be zero.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns the system tick modulus.

DclOsTickResolution

D_UINT32 DclOsTickResolution(void)
Get the system tick resolution in microseconds per tick.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns the system tick resolution.
